paragraphs.text:
%sh
wget http://blueplastic.com/hadoop/users.dat
wget http://blueplastic.com/hadoop/movies.dat
wget http://blueplastic.com/hadoop/ratings.dat

%pyspark
moviesPartsRDD = moviesBaseRDD.map(lambda l: l.split("#"))

print moviesPartsRDD.count()
for m in moviesPartsRDD.take(5): print m

result.msg:
3883
[u'1', u'Toy Story (1995)', u"Animation|Children's|Comedy"]
[u'2', u'Jumanji (1995)', u"Adventure|Children's|Fantasy"]
[u'3', u'Grumpier Old Men (1995)', u'Comedy|Romance']
[u'4', u'Waiting to Exhale (1995)', u'Comedy|Drama']
[u'5', u'Father of the Bride Part II (1995)', u'Comedy']

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

import string
def parseMovieItem(item):
   item[2:2] = [item[2]]
   item[2] = (item[1].rstrip(')'))[-4:]
   item[1] = string.split(item[1], ' (')[0]
   return item

%pyspark

moviesPartsRDD2 = moviesPartsRDD.map(lambda l: parseMovieItem(l))

for m in moviesPartsRDD2.take(4): print m

result.msg:
[u'1', u'Toy Story', u'1995', u"Animation|Children's|Comedy"]
[u'2', u'Jumanji', u'1995', u"Adventure|Children's|Fantasy"]
[u'3', u'Grumpier Old Men', u'1995', u'Comedy|Romance']
[u'4', u'Waiting to Exhale', u'1995', u'Comedy|Drama']

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

moviesRDD = moviesPartsRDD2.map(lambda m: Row(movieid=m[0], title=m[1], year=int(m[2]), genres=m[3]))
moviesRDD.toDF().registerTempTable("movies")

%pyspark

newFilmsRDD = sqlContext.sql("SELECT title, year FROM movies WHERE year > 1995")

for m in newFilmsRDD.take(2): print m

print newFilmsRDD.count()

result.msg:
Row(title=u'Eye for an Eye', year=1996)
Row(title=u"Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood", year=1996)
1436

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

ratingsPartsRDD = ratingsBaseRDD.map(lambda l: l.split("#"))
ratingsRDD = ratingsPartsRDD.map(lambda m: Row(userid=int(m[0]), movieid=int(m[1]), rating=int(m[2]), tstamp=m[3]))
ratingsRDD.toDF().registerTempTable("ratings")

%pyspark

myRDD = sqlContext.sql("SELECT movieid, rating FROM ratings WHERE rating > 2")

for r in myRDD.take(3): print r

result.msg:
Row(movieid=1193, rating=5)
Row(movieid=661, rating=3)
Row(movieid=914, rating=3)

paragraphs.title: Can you figure out what the next few commands do? Hint, we are focusing on just the Toy Story movie, which is ID = 1
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
complexRDD = sqlContext.sql("SELECT ratings.rating, COUNT(ratings.rating) as count FROM ratings WHERE movieid=1 GROUP BY ratings.rating")

print complexRDD.count()

print complexRDD.take(5)

result.msg:
5
[Row(rating=1, count=16), Row(rating=2, count=61), Row(rating=3, count=345), Row(rating=4, count=835), Row(rating=5, count=820)]

paragraphs.title: To get a list of movie ratings with movie titles, we will need to join the ratings and movies tables
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

joinRDD = sqlContext.sql("SELECT ratings.userid, ratings.rating, movies.title FROM ratings JOIN movies ON (ratings.movieid = movies.movieid) LIMIT 5")

print joinRDD.count()

print joinRDD.collect()

result.msg:
5
[Row(userid=2, rating=3, title=u"Soldier's Story, A"), Row(userid=2, rating=5, title=u'Amadeus'), Row(userid=2, rating=2, title=u'Thin Red Line, The'), Row(userid=2, rating=1, title=u'Get Shorty'), Row(userid=3, rating=5, title=u'Caddyshack')]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Actually, the RDD is not cached to memory until we call an action on it. For example, visit the Spark Storage UI and you won’t see any RDD’s listed: http://localhost:4040/storage
